sanskrit_verse:
यस्य शूद्रस्तु कुरुते राज्ञो धर्मविवेचनम् ।
तस्य सीदति तद्राष्ट्रं पङ्के गौरिव पश्यतः ॥ ८.२१॥
transliteration:
yasya śūdrastu kurute rājño dharmavivecanaṁ |

asya sīdati tadraṣṭraṁ paṅke gauriva paśyataḥ || 8.21||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a Śūdra engages in determining the dharma for the king, that kingdom sinks into ruin like a cow in mud.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from consciousness capacity, not birth alone
Misalignment of role creates systemic collapse
Dharma-decision must arise from qualified discernment
Consciousness misidentification leads to civilizational disorder
Restoration requires realignment with one's true capacity
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent lacks qualified consciousness capacity THEN disallow participation in sovereign dharma decisions
IF individual assumes authority beyond their realized state THEN initiate automatic integrity restoration protocol
IF societal function depends on unqualified judgment THEN trigger systemic review and re-alignment process
IF role distortion occurs THEN execute completion sequence until original capacity is restored
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that legal interpretation and sovereign counsel must originate from those whose consciousness has been verified through realization, not merely social position. The threshold of responsibility lies in the capacity to perceive dharma directly, which cannot be substituted by procedural knowledge alone.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: This law operates through pramāṇa-based causality where incorrect alignment between consciousness and function manifests inevitable collapse. It follows anupūrvaśaḥ — sequential degradation when foundational truths are violated. Responsibility is proportional to the degree of consciousness distortion. Punishment is irrelevant; natural consequence restores balance when misaligned functions cease.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadhyaya protocol to restore individual awareness of actual capacity
Activate guru-discipleship completion cycle to realign functional roles
Deploy sankalpa-shuddhi procedures to dissolve false identifications
Engage yajña-karma processes to purify distorted karmic patterns
Reintegrate through varna-dharma alignment based on current spiritual realization
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law is declared: Dharma flows from realized consciousness, not inherited status. Nations rise or fall upon alignment with truth, never upon punishment. Thus it is enacted.
